statements.name: PROC MVOUTLIER
statements.description: invokes the MVOUTLIER procedure and optionally identifies the input data set, specifies the analyses to be performed, and controls displayed output
statements.help:
PROC MVOUTLIER <options>;                 
	DISPLAY <table-list></ options>;                 
	DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                 
	ID  variables;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=libref.data-table <COPYVARS=(variables)><statistic <=name>>...<statistic <=name>>;                 
	VAR  variables;

arguments.name: NPRINCOMP=
arguments.description: specifies the number of principal components to retain for the final subspace; you must specify either this option or the PROPVARIANCE= option, but not both

arguments.name: PROPVARIANCE=
arguments.description: specifies the target proportion of variance to be explained by the principal components, with maximum number of components determined by the value of the NPRINCOMP= option; you must specify either this option or the NPRINCOMP= option, but not both

arguments.name: ALPHALEVERAGE=
arguments.description: specifies the tail probability that determines the robust score distance cutoff value that is used to identify leverage points; by default, ALPHALEVERAGE=0.025

arguments.name: ALPHAMARGINALLEVERAGE=
arguments.description: specifies the tail probability that determines the robust score distance cutoff value to use for inclusion in the Diagnostics table or labeling in the diagnostic plot; by default, it is set to the value of the ALPHALEVERAGE= option

arguments.name: ALPHAMARGINALOUTLIER=
arguments.description: specifies the tail probability that determines the orthogonal distance cutoff value to use for inclusion in the Diagnostics table or labeling in the diagnostic plot; by default, it is set to the value of the ALPHAOUTLIER= option

arguments.name: ALPHAOUTLIER=
arguments.description: specifies the tail probability that determines the orthogonal distance cutoff value that is used to identify outliers; by default, ALPHAOUTLIER=0.025

arguments.name: APPLYROWORDER
arguments.description: uses a data distribution and row order as determined by a previous partition action call

arguments.name: CONTAMINATION=
arguments.description: specifies the fraction of observations that are corrupted; its value must be less than or equal to 0.5, and its default value is 0.25

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC MVOUTLIER to use

arguments.name: DIAGNOSTICOPTIONS
arguments.description: specifies options for the Diagnostics table

arguments.name: MAXOBS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of observations to include in the Diagnostics table

arguments.name: SHOWOBSID
arguments.description: includes the automatically assigned observation ID in the Diagnostics table

arguments.name: EIGENVEC
arguments.description: creates the Eigenvectors table, which is produced only if you specify this option

arguments.name: INITONLY
arguments.description: stops the analysis just before the point where the final number of principal components is determined; this saves computation time if you want to obtain only the information relevant to determining how many principal components to retain for the final subspace

arguments.name: LOADINGS
arguments.description: creates the Loadings table, which is produced only if you specify this option

arguments.name: NPRINCOMPMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the largest feasible number of principal components that you would expect to retain for the final subspace, given the target proportion of variance to explain; it is used in conjunction with the PROPVARIANCE= option, and by default, NPRINCOMPMAX=10

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: controls the plots that are produced through ODS Graphics

arguments.name: UNPACKPANEL
arguments.description: suppresses paneling in the scree plot

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all appropriate plots

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses the display of all plots

arguments.name: DIAGNOSTIC
arguments.description: produces a plot of orthogonal distances versus robust score distances that identifies outliers and leverage points

arguments.name: ALPHAMARGINALLEVERAGE=
arguments.description: specifies the tail probability that determines the robust score distance cutoff value for labeling an observation in the diagnostic plot

arguments.name: ALPHAMARGINALOUTLIER=
arguments.description: specifies the tail probability that determines the orthogonal distance cutoff value for labeling an observation in the diagnostic plot

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the type of label to use for outliers and leverage points in the diagnostic plot

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: shows no labels

arguments.name: ID
arguments.description: uses values of the first ID variable

arguments.name: NUMBER
arguments.description: uses an automatically assigned observation ID

arguments.name: MAXOBS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of observations to display in the diagnostic plot

arguments.name: SCREE
arguments.description: produces a scree plot of eigenvalues and proportion of variance explained for the initial robust subspace, at the stage where the final number of principal components must be chosen

arguments.name: NPRINCOMPDISPLAY=
arguments.description: specifies the number of principal components to display in the scree plot

arguments.name: PROPVARDISPLAYMAX=
arguments.description: sets the number of principal components to display in the scree plot to the lowest number that explains at least the specified proportion of variance

arguments.name: UNPACKPANEL
arguments.description: suppresses paneling for the scree plot so that the eigenvalue plot and proportion of variance plot appear in separate panels

arguments.name: PREFIX=
arguments.description: specifies a prefix for naming the principal components in the Eigenvectors and Loadings tables; the default name is Prin, which produces the component names Prin1, Prin2, Prin3, and so on

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies the seed to use for random number generation

statements.name: DISPLAY
statements.description: enables you to specify a list of display tables to display or exclude

arguments.name: CASESENSITIVE
arguments.description: performs a case-sensitive comparison of table names in the table-list to display table names when tables are subsetted for display

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: displays all display tables except those that you specify in the table-list

arguments.name: EXCLUDEALL
arguments.description: suppresses display of all tables

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: displays the display table names, labels, and paths

statements.name: DISPLAYOUT
statements.description: enables you to create output tables from your displayed output
statements.help: DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                                              *table-spec-list* specifies a list of output tables in key=value or key format                     *key=value* specifies *key* as the ODS table name, path, or partial pathname, and *value* as the output table name                     *key* is the ODS table name and the output table name

arguments.name: INCLUDEALL
arguments.description: creates output tables for all display tables

arguments.name: NOREPLACE
arguments.description: does not replace any existing output table of the same name

arguments.name: REPEATED
arguments.description: replicates all output tables on all nodes

statements.name: ID
statements.description: specifies which variables to display in output that includes information about individual observations, instead of displaying the automatically assigned observation ID

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates a data table that contains observationwise statistics, which are computed after PROC MVOUTLIER fits the model; if you do not specify a keyword, then the orthogonal distance and robust score distance are included

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC MVOUTLIER to use

arguments.name: COPYVARS=
arguments.description: transfers one or more variables from the input data table to the output data table

arguments.name: LEVERAGE
arguments.description: adds a leverage indicator to the output data table that is set to 1 if the robust score distance exceeds its cutoff and 0 otherwise; the default variable name is Leverage

arguments.name: NODEID
arguments.description: adds a node ID to the output data table that reveals which computer processes the observation; the default variable name is NodeId

arguments.name: OBSID
arguments.description: adds the automatically assigned observation ID to the output data table; the default variable name is ObsId

arguments.name: ORTHDIST
arguments.description: adds the orthogonal distance between the observation and the final subspace to the output data table; the default variable name is OrthDist

arguments.name: OUTLIER
arguments.description: adds an outlier indicator to the output data table that is set to 1 if the orthogonal distance exceeds its cutoff and 0 otherwise; the default variable name is Outlier

arguments.name: SCORE
arguments.description: adds principal component scores for each principal component to the output data table; the default variable prefix is Score

arguments.name: SCOREDIST
arguments.description: adds the robust score distance to the output data table, which is the distance between the observation after being projected onto the final subspace and the robust location estimate of the subspace mean; the default variable name is ScoreDist

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: lists the numeric variables to be analyzed; if you omit this statement, all numeric variables that are not specified in other statements are analyzed
